headline: Why Robinhood is offering tokenized trading in the EU: CEO
summary: Robinhood (HOOD) unveiled new stock and ETF tokens, expanding its reach in the European market and building on its crypto offerings. Robinhood CEO and Chairman Vlad Tenev joins Market Domination with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to discuss the new offerings, Robinhood's crypto strategy, the future of blockchain, and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Robinhood Stock Jumps 12%. How Crypto Is Fueling the Rally.
summary: Tokenized stocks—a much-hyped asset class among crypto bulls—mimic the underlying equities, but are issued via blockchain technology rather than traditional exchanges.  The company is prepared to introduce the product in the U.S. if crypto futures receive approval from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, said Johann Kerbrat, the general manager of Robinhood Crypto.

raw.headline: Robinhood Stock Jumps 12%. How Crypto Is Fueling the Rally.
raw.summary: Tokenized stocks—a much-hyped asset class among crypto bulls—mimic the underlying equities, but are issued via blockchain technology rather than traditional exchanges.  The company is prepared to introduce the product in the U.S. if crypto futures receive approval from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, said Johann Kerbrat, the general manager of Robinhood Crypto.

headline: Why Robinhood Stock Is Soaring Today
summary: Robinhood is launching commission-free tokenized trading in the EU, allowing 24/7 trading of over 200 U.S. stocks and ETFs.  The company is expanding its crypto offerings with perpetual futures and staking to compete with native crypto exchanges.  Shares of Robinhood Markets (NASDAQ: HOOD) are spiking on Monday, up 12.1% as of 3:24 p.m. ET.

raw.headline: Why Robinhood Stock Is Soaring Today

The company is expanding its crypto offerings with perpetual futures and staking to compete with native crypto exchanges.  Shares of Robinhood Markets (NASDAQ: HOOD) are spiking on Monday, up 12.1% as of 3:24 p.m. ET.

headline: Circle Stock Rocketed After the IPO. Wall Street Disagrees on What Happens Next.
summary: Circle Internet Group stock hasn’t behaved normally since the June 5 initial public offering.  As of Friday’s close, shares of the stablecoin issuer have risen more than 450% to $180.43 from their IPO price of $31.  The stock has swung double-digit percentages—both up and down—on 10 of 16 trading sessions.

headline: Circle Stock Soared in June. Wall Street Disagrees on What Direction Shares Will Go Next.
summary: Circle Internet Group hasn’t behaved like a normal stock since going public on June 5.  As of Friday’s close, shares of the stablecoin-issuer have risen more than 450% to $180.43 from their initial public offering price of $31.  The stock has swung double-digit percentages—both up and down—on 10 of 16 trading sessions.

raw.headline: Circle Stock Soared in June. Wall Street Disagrees on What Direction Shares Will Go Next.
raw.summary: Circle Internet Group hasn’t behaved like a normal stock since going public on June 5.  As of Friday’s close, shares of the stablecoin-issuer have risen more than 450% to $180.43 from their initial public offering price of $31.  The stock has swung double-digit percentages—both up and down—on 10 of 16 trading sessions.

headline: Robinhood launches tokens allowing EU users to trade in US stocks
summary: (Reuters) -Robinhood said on Monday it has launched tokens that will allow its customers in the European Union to trade more than 200 U.S. stocks and exchange-traded funds, including Nvidia, Apple and Microsoft.  The commission-free tokens can be traded around-the-clock, five days a week.  Robinhood also plans to offer tokens linked to stocks of privately-held companies, starting with Sam Altman's OpenAI and Elon Musk's SpaceX, the trading platform's top executives said at its keynote event in France.

raw.headline: Robinhood launches tokens allowing EU users to trade in US stocks
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Robinhood said on Monday it has launched tokens that will allow its customers in the European Union to trade more than 200 U.S. stocks and exchange-traded funds, including Nvidia, Apple and Microsoft.  The commission-free tokens can be traded around-the-clock, five days a week.  Robinhood also plans to offer tokens linked to stocks of privately-held companies, starting with Sam Altman's OpenAI and Elon Musk's SpaceX, the trading platform's top executives said at its keynote event in France.
